business.headline: Stock market crash: 3 reasons why Sensex, Nifty are under pressure todaySensex falls over 400 points: The S&P BSE Sensex declined by 467.32 points, or 0.58%, to 80,217.13, while the Nifty shed 135.60 points, or 0.54%, to 24,205.35.

Explained: Why Enviro Infra share price fell 10% in early trade today The decline in Enviro Infra's share price comes on the same day the company is set to announce its financial performance for the quarter ended September 30, 2024.
Mobikwik shares make bumper debut: Should you book profit? Mobikwik share price: The stock of Mobikwik opened on the BSE at Rs 442.25, listing at a premium of 58.51% over the issue price of Rs 279.

Sai Life Sciences shares debut at 18% premium on stock exchanges Sai Life Sciences share price today: Sai Life Sciences shares made a strong debut on Wednesday, listing at a premium of 18% on the NSE, with the stock opening at Rs 650, which is Rs 101 above its issue price.

Bumper debut for Mobikwik shares as stocks list at 59% premium on Dalal StreetMobikwik share price: The shares of One Mobikwik Systems debuted on the BSE at Rs 442.25, marking a 58.51% premium over the issue price of Rs 279.
Vishal Mega Mart shares make strong market debut at 33% premium on D-Street Vishal Mega Mart share price: The stock began trading at Rs 104, at a premium of 33% over its issue price of Rs 78.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as cautious investors weigh global trendsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 15.56 points to 80,668.89, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4 points to 24,332.00.

Facebook owner Meta hit with 251 million euros in fines for 2018 data breachIreland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties to Meta after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code.

Cryptocurrencies to be taxed as capital gains: Relief for pre-FY23 earningsThe Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) decision defines cryptocurrencies as capital assets, distinguishing pre-2022 profits as capital gains and applying a 30% flat tax to post-2022 transactions.

Income Tax Department admits error of sending wrong ITR notices. Check details The Income Tax Department has acknowledged its mistake in sending defective ITR notices, offering relief to many, though taxpayers who filed revised returns could face complications.

Will India's economic growth pick up pace? Nirmala Sitharaman answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a 'temporary blip'.

Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.

Sensex plunges over 1,000 points as bearish sentiment grips marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1064.12 points to end the day at 80,684.45, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 332.25 points to close at 24,336.00.
EPFO members may soon approve their own PF withdrawals: ReportCurrently, withdrawing PF funds involves multiple checks and balances, with subscribers required to submit forms and wait for approvals.
EPFO high pension: Why have 1.7 million applied for higher EPS contribution?Launched in 1995, the Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS-95) offers social security to organised sector employees.

ITC shares rise as ITC Hotels demerger set for January 1, 2025: Key detailsITC Hotels demerger announcement came after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Kolkata Bench, approved the scheme of arrangement between ITC and ITC Hotels.

How big corporates are choking middle class, hurting India growth storyThe government gave tax relief to private companies in 2019 hoping they would invest in people and infrastructure. It was counterproductive. Big corporates pocketed profits and froze real wages of employees. Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.
Traffic challans in Delhi? Know how to get them waived off starting December 20Delhi Police launches Evening Court sessions from December 20 to clear pending traffic fines.

Dam Capital IPO: Check opening date, price band, gmp, issue details  DAM Capital Advisors' IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders.

Concord Enviro IPO opening date: Check GMP, price band, other detailsThe Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 500.33 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 0.25 crore shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.46 crore shares worth Rs 325.33 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: R Ashwin retires from international cricket: Bit of punch left in meIndia off-spinner R Ashwin announced his retirement from all formats of cricket on Wednesday after the end of the third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Rohit Sharma confirmed R Ashwin had hinted about his retirement at the start of the series.

Congress seeks Amit Shah's resignation over Ambedkar 'fashion' remarkSeveral opposition MPs, including Rahul Gandhi, staged a protest in Parliament demanding Amit Shah's resignation for his Rajya Sabha remarks that they claimed were an insult to Ambedkar.

Farmers stage 'rail roko' protest in Punjab after 'Dilli Chalo' attempts crushedFarmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher confirmed that the protest is part of their ongoing agitation that began on February 13 when security forces stopped farmers' marches to Delhi at the Shambhu and Khanauri border points between Punjab and Haryana.

US announces H-1B visa overhaul to fill jobs faster; Indians may benefit mostThe Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has announced its decision to modernise the H-1B visa programme, effective January 17, 2025. The aim is to streamline and expedite the H1-B visa approval process and provide greater flexibility for employers to retain top talent. Indians are likely to benefit the most.

Suitcase-sized model of Gaganyaan's radio to be tested in GermanyThe Gaganyaan mission, which aims to send Indian astronauts into space, represents a landmark achievement for the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro).

Virat Kohli reacts to Ashwin retirement: When you told me, it made me emotional R Ashwin retires: Former captain Virat Kohli came up with a heartfelt post on social media, thanking R Ashwin for his match-winning contributions to Indian cricket. Kohli and Ashwin shared a warm embrace on the off-spinner's last day as an international cricketer.

Stock market crash: 3 reasons why Sensex, Nifty are under pressure todaySensex falls over 400 points: The S&P BSE Sensex declined by 467.32 points, or 0.58%, to 80,217.13, while the Nifty shed 135.60 points, or 0.54%, to 24,205.35.

Nitin Gadkari, 19 BJP MPs skip One Nation One Poll session, may get notice: SourcesThe party had issued a three-line whip mandating all MPs to be present in the House for the session. Despite the backlash, the Bill secured 269 votes in favour, while 198 MPs voted against it following a 90-minute debate and a division of votes.

Gabba Test: Convinced R Ashwin to stay for pink-ball Test, reveals Rohit SharmaIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he had to convince R Ashwin to stay for the pink-ball Test as the spinner announced his retirement from the game after the mathc in Gabba.

Zomato's reply to techie who accused it of selling Rs 10 water bottles for Rs 100Zomato has addressed allegations by a Hyderabad-based techie who accused the company of inflating the price of Rs 10 water bottles to Rs 100 at concert venues.

Delhi Lt Governor asks Atishi to convene Assembly session on Dec 19-20Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Wednesday asked Delhi Chief Minister Atishi to convene a special session of the Delhi Legislative Assembly on December 19-20 to discuss 14 pending Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) reports.

SpaceX lost communication, control of Dragon during private spacewalkThe outage was triggered by a leak in a cooling system at SpaceX's Hawthorne facility, causing a power surge that disabled mission control's ability to communicate with its Dragon spacecraft in orbit.
Perfectly spherical egg sold for Rs 21,000 at auction in UK. Yes, you read that rightA perfectly spherical egg dubbed a "one-in-a-billion" was sold for £200 (Rs 21,000 approx) at auction in the UK.

Has Tejashwi taken a leaf out of INDIA ally Hemant Soren's playbook?The RJD leader's 'Mai-Behan Maan Yojana', mirroring a successful cash grant scheme in Jharkhand, aims to galvanise women and break the NDA's electoral hold over Bihar

When government prioritises...: Rahul Gandhi as trade deficit hits all-time highWith India's trade deficit in November surging to an all-time high, Rahul Gandhi blamed it on the government's prioritisation of 'crony businesses' over 'play-fair businesses'.

ED restores Rs 22,000 crore of assets from Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi: MinisterThe Finance Minister pointed out that among the major cases, the ED has recovered properties valued at Rs 14,131.6 crore belonging to fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya, which were subsequently restored to public sector banks.
Why do India and China have a single time zone?India follows a single time zone called Indian Standard Time (IST), which is set at GMT+5:30.

Has the hangman's noose helped China curb big scams?China on Tuesday executed a former Communist party official who was convicted in a $421-million financial scam. China often hands down death sentences and tough jail terms in big corruption cases. Has the hangman's noose actually helped China bring down cases of corruption and the magnitude of scams?

In stats: R Ashwin ends international career as one of the greatest spinnersStar off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin ended his India career with a total of 765 international wickets from 287 matches. Ashwin is bowing out of the game as the country's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests.

If they tax us, we tax them: Trump warns India over tariffs on US goodsDonald Trump warned that if India continues to impose high tariffs on US goods, his administration would respond with reciprocal tariffs. He emphasised that trade should be fair, and any tax imposed on the US would be met with the same treatment.

IIT Bombay alumnus says he became multi-millionaire in 20s without 'ideal habits'In a post on X, an IIT Bombay alumnus revealed that he achieved multi-millionaire status in his 20s without adhering to the so-called "ideal habits".
Russia develops new vaccine against cancer: ReportRussian news agency claims the country has developed an mRNA vaccine against cancer. It is set to be available free of charge to patients by 2025.

AUS vs IND, 3rd Test Day 5: Gritty India, rain deny Australia Gabba redemptionA gritty performance from India and rain denied Australia from securing a win as the 3rd Test at the Gabba ended in a draw. The hosts had posted a target of 275 runs for India to chase but the weather would force an early close to the game on Wednesday, December 18.

Starlink devices made by Elon Musk's SpaceX seized from Manipur outfit: SourcesAccording to security officials, the recovery of the Starlink devices has prompted relevant agencies to investigate how the equipment found its way to the strife-torn state even after not having a licence to operate in India.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab postponed to a later date: ReportsTelugu superstar Prabhas and director Maruthi's upcoming film, The Raja Saab, was due for release on April 10, 2025. Now, reports suggest that the film's release has been postponed.

Hema Malini meets Gulzar on flight: Recalled wonderful movies we've made togetherBollywood actor Hema Malini recently shared delightful pictures from her meeting with renowned lyricist and filmmaker Gulzar. Alongside the pictures, Hema also shared a heartfelt note.

The Roshans: Rakesh Roshan, Hrithik Roshan's Netflix docu-series release date outThe Netflix documentary on Hrithik Roshan's family titled The Roshans will premiere on January 17, 2025. The series will center around the Roshan family, highlighting their lasting impact on the industry.

What a man: Mahira Khan recalls meeting Sanjay Leela Bhansali for HeeramandiPakistani actor Mahira Khan reveals how political tensions stopped her from starring in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Heeramandi, originally planned as a film with Pakistani stars 18 years ago.

sports.headline: R Ashwin announces retirement from international cricket after Gabba testIndian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from all formats of international cricket. He confirmed the decision by declaring it was his last day as an Indian cricketer during a press conference with captain Rohit Sharma at the Gabba in Brisbane.

Lyon said he had "nothing but respect" for Ashwin and hailed his skillset as "incredible."

Stand at Eden Gardens named after Jhulan: 'It will motivate young cricketers' Legendary fast bowler Jhulan Goswami expressed her honour at the Cricket Association of Bengal's gesture to rename a stand at the iconic Eden Gardens after her. The former India cricketer added that the stand would inspire many young women cricketers

Samson snubbed from Kerala's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, Nizar to leadSanju Samson's exclusion from Kerala's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad raised questions, especially after his impactful Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy performances. Salman Nizar's appointment as captain set the tone for Kerala's revamped 19-member lineup for the tournament.

Salman Agha shares Player Of The Match award with Saim Ayub after 1st ODI winSalman Agha won the hearts of the fans as the Pakistan vice-captain decided to share his Player Of The Match award with Saim Ayub after Pakistan's thrilling win over South Africa on Tuesday, December 17. Ayub and Aga

Gabba Test: Bumrah breaks Kapil Dev's all-time record for India in AustraliaJasprit Bumrah has broken Kapil Dev's record in Australia as he dismissed Usman Khawaja and Marnus Labuschagne on Day 5 of the Gabba Test. Bumrah has continued to be India's best player in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Harbhajan Singh had a funny take on the episode.

Watch: Akash Deep's innocent banter with Travis Head in Gabba TestA tense exchange between Akash Deep and Travis Head on Day 5 of the Brisbane Test added to the drama, as India's lower order defied Australia's attack to narrow the deficit and keep the contest alive.

Gabba Test: Lightning stops play on Day 5, ICC's '30-30' rule explainedThe 3rd Test between India and Australia at the Gabba faced an unexpected halt on Day 5 due to lightning. Here's a look at the ICC's '30-30 rule' which makes the umpires call off play when there is a lightning threat.

Amidst Manchester United exit talk, Marcus Rashford ready for 'new challenge'Manchester United's Marcus Rashford has sparked speculation about his future, hinting at a desire for a new challenge. Rashford has struggled to make an impact this season for the Red Devils.

Vinicius Jr named FIFA Best of 2024 after Ballon d'Or snub to RodriAfter missing out on the 2024 Ballon d'Or to Rodri, Real Madrid winger Vinicius Jr was awarded the FIFA Best 2024 for his stellar season with Los Blancos. Bonmati retained her FIFA Best Women's Player player award with Alejandro Garnacho winning the Puskas.

SA vs PAK: Agha-Ayub brilliance helps Pakistan clinch thrilling win in 1st ODISaim Ayub's incredible hundred and Salman Agha's all-round performance helped Pakistan secure a thrilling win in the first ODI. Ayub and Agha's partnership helped Pakistan secure the 3-wicket win in the end.

Mitchell Santner replaces Kane Williamson as new New Zealand white-ball captainNew Zealand have announced that Mitchell Santner will be taking over from Kane Williamson as the new white-ball captain of the side. Santner will begin his captaincy with the upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
